content.title: 英国の組合、Deliverooで労働者の権利を求めるための最新入札を失った - ロイター英国
content.desc: The High Court has rejected the latest attempt by a British trade union to push for workers' rights at food courier Deliveroo, in a case which is a rare example of gig economy firms successfully defending their business models. The Independent Workers Union of Great Britain (IWGB) wants to represent riders in the north London area of Camden, hoping to secure rights such as the minimum wage, which they are not currently entitled to, due to being classified as self-employed. Firms such as Uber [UBER.UL] in the gig economy - where many people work for multiple employers without fixed contracts...

content.title: 団体交渉の権利がないDeliverooのライダー -  Financial Times
content.source_nm: ファイナンシャルタイムズ
content.desc: Deliveroo riders are not entitled to collective bargaining the High Court ruled on Wednesday in the latest legal case for the “gig” economy. The High Court dismissed a judicial review challenge brought by the Independent Workers Union of Great Britain, a trade union, which argued that it should be recognised by the food delivery company for the purposes of collective bargaining for its riders. The union claimed that not allowing collective bargaining breached the human rights of Deliveroo riders, under Article 11 of the European Convention on Human Rights. It brought the legal challenge aft...
